div.p: Kinder-5/6th grade students can access homework using the following links to Microsoft OneDrive. Each grade has its own folder, as do our specials classes (art, music, ect).
Camp Verde: Camp Verde K-5 OneDrive
Specials: AHA Specials (Music K-6, Art K-6 & 9th, PE K-6 & 9th)

p.strong: Middle/High School students your homework link will be under your campus tabs at the top of the page or just click here:

iframe.title: “Camp Verde Online Homework” — American Heritage Academy

hr.p: If you have any trouble or questions please feel free to email either Traci (Camp Verde campus) tcunningham@edkey.org or myself (Cottonwood campus) sschlieter@edkey.org.

div.p: We promote America’s founding principles through a classical liberal arts education fostering personal greatness, community service, strong academic and leadership skills, while reaffirming hope in a caring environment.

div.h2: What’s So Special About American Heritage Academy
div.p: American Heritage Academy (AHA) is a non-profit 501(c)(3) public charter school that was founded in 1995 by a group of “home-school” parents. It received its charter from the State of Arizona to educate students in traditional basics, with emphasis on the great role models of the past. Concerned about the lack of statesmen, conservation of America’s freedoms and classically trained leaders, AHA was formed to “build tomorrow’s heroes today.” Students come to have a knowledge of and respect for the ideals and values of the great men and women of history, particularly our founding fathers.
The American Heritage Academy serves students at two campuses in Central Arizona: Camp Verde, grades K-8 and Cottonwood, grades K-12.
We’re here to answer your questions.

div.h2:
AHA is a Testing Site
for the PSAT/NMSQT
div.p: American Heritage Academy (AHA) is a testing center for its own students and is open to testing all home school students and other public school students who wish to do so. For more information visit American Heritage Academy’s PSAT/NMSQT Website.
We’re here to answer your questions.
